homePage.quickProv: Quickly provision your users or groups
homePage.advProv: Provision users with a guided wizard to set up Directory Sync, Single Sign-On and customised reports
homePage.convertUsersText:
Convert employees of your organisation who have signed up for Project Squared on their own with a company e-mail address to a licenced user. Licenced users receive additional enterprise features and are subject to your organisation's policies and administration.

Selected users will receive an invitation to convert or change their e-mail address to a non-company e-mail address.
homePage.name: Name
homePage.installDeviceText: Install a device for a user
homePage.installSharedSpaceText: Install a device into a Shared Space
homePage.convertText: View and convert users currently using the free version

inviteModal.title: Service entitlement
inviteModal.heading: Enable service entitlement
inviteModal.content: Invite users in the organisation to use Squared...

ssoModal.title: Setup SSO
ssoModal.disableSSO: Use the built-in identity service for user authentication (simple)
ssoModal.importMetadataDesc: Begin configuring the trust relationship between your identity provider (IdP) and the Cisco Collaboration Cloud by obtaining a trust metadata file from your IdP and uploading it here
ssoModal.exportMetadataDesc1: Download the following trust metadata file from the Cisco Collaboration service and upload it into your identity provider (IdP) management interface
ssoModal.exportMetadataDesc2: When you have finished uploading the file into your IdP, return to this screen and press Next
ssoModal.testSSOSetupDesc: You are ready to test your SSO configuration. Press the button below to launch a new window. If you are able to sign in successfully, you can return to this screen and press Next to finalise your SSO setup
ssoModal.enableSSODesc: If you are ready to enable Single Sign-On (SSO) for all users, press the Finish button. All user authentication will then be processed through your new SSO provider
ssoModal.importFailed: Failed to import IdP metadata file
ssoModal.readFileFailed: Could not read IdP metadata file
ssoModal.enableSSOSuccess: Single Sign-On (SSO) successfully enabled for all users
ssoModal.finalEnableSSO: The test was successful. Enable Single Sign-On
ssoModal.finalDisableSSO: The test was unsuccessful. Disable Single Sign-On
ssoModal.diableSuccess: Single Sign-On (SSO) successfully disabled for all users
ssoModal.enableSSOFailure: Failed to disable Single Sign On (SSO).

serviceSetupModal.tzDescription: Specify the time zone to use for schedule-based call routing. For example, this time zone applies to calls routed based on business hours and holiday schedules
serviceSetupModal.oddDescription: Specify the number users must dial before placing an external call
serviceSetupModal.internalNumberRangeDescription: Specify the range of internal numbers. The length of 4 or 5 numbers is recommended
serviceSetupModal.mohDescription: Provide callers with music, announcements, or video when they are placed on hold. You can change the MOH settings at the group or user level

dirsyncModal.chooseSyncDesc: Do you want to manually enter users or synchronise users from Active Directory?
dirsyncModal.title: Directory Sync
dirsyncModal.domainDesc: Identify the Active Directory domain you will be syncing
dirsyncModal.installStep1: 1. Download and install the Cisco Cloud Connector in your enterprise
dirsyncModal.installStep2: 2. Configure the Active Directory synchronisation agreement
dirsyncModal.nextSteps: Press the Next button when you're ready to verify that the identity information is being synchronised
dirsyncModal.autoAssignText: Auto-assign users into groups as they are synchronised
dirsyncModal.groupAssignmentDesc: Users will be auto-provisioned with services based on the default entitlements and policies for the group. If you would like to change the default provisioning settings, please visit the groups page
dirsyncModal.getDomainFailed: Failed to retrieve Directory Sync configuration
dirsyncModal.setDomainFailed: Failed to create a Directory Sync domain
dirsyncModal.getStatusFailed: Failed to retrieve a Directory Sync status
dirsyncModal.getListFailed: Failed to retrieve a user list

unauthorizedPage.title: Unauthorised
unauthorizedPage.text: You are not authorised to access the page you requested

errors.status403: Authorisation failed. You do not have administrator privileges. You will be logged out in a few seconds.
errors.status401: Authorisation failed. Server unable to process the authorisation token. You will automatically be logged out in a few seconds
errors.serverDown: Authorisation failed. Server may be down, please contact system administrator. You will automatically be logged out in a few seconds
errors.expired: Your session has expired or is unauthorised. You will automatically be logged out in a few seconds. Please login again to continue using the service
errors.unsupported: You are using an outdated version of Internet Explorer. Please upgrade your browser to version 11 or higher

spacesPage.title: Devices
spacesPage.addDeviceStep1: Where will this device be installed?
spacesPage.addDeviceStep1Desc: It is recommended that you use the name of your conference room or shared space as it is shown in your company directory. The video address for this device will use this name. It will also be the easiest way to search for and find the device in the system later.
spacesPage.emptyDevices1: Once you add a new device,
spacesPage.deleteDeviceConfText: Are you sure you want to delete this device?

status.unknown: reports an unknown state. Please check the expressway for details
status.not_configured: has installed the service, but it's not configured
status.offline: has not posted status a while and could be offline
status.registered: is registered but has not yet posted status

firstTimeWizard.simpleSub: All you need are users' e-mail addresses
firstTimeWizard.planReviewDesc: This setup wizard will enable you to quickly get collaboration services up and running for your organisation. If you're not sure what to do in any given step, don't worry, you can always make changes later
firstTimeWizard.chooseSyncDesc: Do you want to manually enter users or synchronise users from Active Directory?
firstTimeWizard.domainDesc: Identify the Active Directory domain you will be syncing
firstTimeWizard.installStep1: 1. Download and install the Cisco Cloud Connector in your enterprise
firstTimeWizard.installStep2: 2. Configure the Active Directory synchronisation agreement
firstTimeWizard.nextSteps: Press the Next button when you're ready to verify that the identity information is being synchronised
firstTimeWizard.setupSSODesc: Please select the appropriate option for your SSO configuration
firstTimeWizard.manualInvite: Enter the e-mail addresses of persons in your company who will receive Collaboration Services. They will receive an e-mail invitation to sign up
firstTimeWizard.domainSubDesc: Enter the AD domain to sync with:
firstTimeWizard.connectorSteps: Follow these steps in order to install the Cloud Connector:
firstTimeWizard.finishDesc: You have completed the setup wizard. If you have skipped steps or need to change any of the settings, click the Gear icon in the upper right corner of the page to access this panel again

callPark.information1: The Call Park feature allows you to place a call on hold, so that it can be retrieved from another phone in the system. If you are on an active call at your phone, you can park the call to a Call Park extension by pressing the Park softkey or the Call Park button. Someone on another phone in your system can then dial the Call Park extension to retrieve the call
callPark.information2: You can define either a single directory number or a range of directory numbers for use as call park extension numbers. You can park only one call at each Call Park extension number
callPark.deleteConfirmation: This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to delete this Call Park?
callPark.createDescription: Allow users to place a call on hold, so that it can be retrieved from another endpoint
callPark.name: Name
callPark.numbersDescription: The system will dynamically assign a Call Park number for the user. Alternatively, you can select specific number(s)
callPark.retrievalPrefixDescription: Dial this number before the Call Park number to retrieve a parked call. No alpha characters
callPark.callReversionDescription: This defines the routing of the call when it is not picked up

partnerProfile.name: Company name
partnerProfile.supportInfo: If you are providing support for your customers' users, enter your support parameters below. These parameters will be displayed under Support Options in the Squared applications
partnerProfile.lifeCycle: Lifecycle partners are required to provide both types of support shown below
partnerProfile.urlFaq: URL for help site and FAQs
partnerProfile.urlFaqEx: http://[url of Cisco help site and FAQs]
partnerProfile.urlReport: URL for reporting trouble tickets or opening cases
partnerProfile.matchingDescr: To match trouble tickets with the logs uploaded to the Cisco Collaboration Management tool when reports are created, append your support URL with your logID parameter as "%%logID%%" (no quotes)
partnerProfile.ciscoProblem: Problems reported will be sent to the Cisco Technical Support team
partnerProfile.enterHelp: Enter the location of your help content
partnerProfile.enterReports: Problem reports: enter the location of your problem reporting tool
